meanings.definition: A short, broad sword with a slightly curved blade, used as a weapon or for cutting vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The pirate brandished his cutlass during the battle.
meanings.sent2: The gardener used a cutlass to clear the overgrown bushes.
meanings.sent3: The cutlass seemed to have a mind of its own, swinging wildly through the air.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as sharp as a cutlass, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gleam of the cutlass in the sunlight struck fear into the hearts of the enemies.

meanings.definition: A tool or weapon with a short, thick blade.
meanings.sent1: The sailor kept a trusty cutlass by his side at all times.
meanings.sent2: The explorer relied on his cutlass to hack through the dense jungle.
meanings.sent3: In a world of high-tech gadgets, he felt a simple cutlass was all he needed.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a sharp cutlass, slicing through any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The cutlass gleamed in the moonlight, a silent guardian in the darkness.
